item.title: Inner Product Space
item.description: An inner product space is a vector space with a defined inner product, not a vector space of inner products. Basic Inner Product Definition 1 (Dot Product) \[\mathbf{a} \cdot \mathbf{b} = ||\mathbf{a}||\, ||\mathbf{b}|| \cos(\gamma)\] Since we are working in an Euclidean space, the dot product is equivalent to the \(\ell_2\) norm squared. \[\mathbf{a} \cdot \mathbf{a} = \mathbf{a^\top a}\] Definition 2 (Projection) A projection of \(\mathbf{a}\) on to \(\mathbf{b}\) could be defined in terms of the dot product.
